Comment: Having talked to my share, I don't think they really think of it that way.  I think they just get way too hung up on this idea that someone who hasn't 'earned' something might get something.  They, of course, have EARNED the thing, because of all their "Very unique" and real circumstances, but it doesn't clock for them that, no, not everyone living on the streets is continuously coked out, no, that family on welfare isn't deliberately exploiting the system by having so many kids, and that kids on food stamps have birthdays too!  Assume the worst of everyone outside their insular little circle.  Now, the racists DO exist, it'd be ludicrous to claim otherwise, but the hard core "I want to hurt black people ON PURPOSE" racists don't account for electoral wins the way they once did.  Far more likely is the racist full of implicit prejudice who objects strongly to the idea that there could be any systematic holding people back.  When you discuss systematic racism, the response you get most often isn't "Good", it's "Yeah, well where's my million dollar home for being white, huh?  Just because I'm white doesn't mean I have it easy!"  Ignorant of all the ways they DO have it easier than their own neighbors because of their skin.
